alert.note: Alert for Adams; Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 10:19AM CDT until further notice by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Wisconsin River at Castle Rock Dam affecting Juneau and Adams Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Wisconsin River at Castle Rock Dam. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 30,000.0 cfs, Localized flooding occurs near Highway Z and HH downstream of the dam. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1010 AM CDT Wednesday the flow was 32,057 cfs. - Recent Activity...The maximum river flow in the 24 hours ending at 10:10 AM CDT Wednesday was 32,706 cfs. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood flow is 30,000 cfs. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued later today after 4 PM CDT.
